intro: Calyptranthes uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower calyptranthes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
